fields.title: loopy belief propagation
fields.pointers:
* The  [Brouwer fixed point theorem](brouwer_fixed_point_theorem)  implies that loopy BP has at least one fixed point.
* Loopy BP  [can be viewed](loopy_bp_as_variational)  as a  [variational inference](variational_inference)  algorithm which tries to minimize the Bethe free energy. 
* In the case of Gaussian graphical models, loopy BP is  [guaranteed to converge](gaussian_loopy_belief_propagation)  to the correct mean. 
* Loopy BP is  [guaranteed to converge](loopy_bp_single_loop)  in graphs with a single loop.
fields.summary: The sum-product and max-product algorithms give exact answers for tree graphical models, but if we apply the same update rules on a general graph, it often gives pretty reasonable results. This is known as loopy belief propagation, and it is a widely used approximate inference algorithm in coding theory and low level vision.
